009package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018import imagingbook.common.math.exception.MaxIterationsExceededException;
019
020/**
021 * Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a real matrix. This code has been ported from
022 * https://math.nist.gov/javanumerics/jama/ (Version 1.0.3), with the public API
023 * (and some internals) adapted to Apache Commons Math. Most comments below were
024 * taken from the original sources.
025 * <p>
026 * This is intended as a temporary substitute for Apache Commons Math's
027 * implementation ({@link org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition},
028 * whose symmetry tolerance appears to be too low and thus returns complex
029 * eigenvalues for close-to-symmetric matrices although solutions with real
030 * eigenvalues exist.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * If A is symmetric, then A = V*D*V' where the eigenvalue matrix D is diagonal
034 * and the eigenvector matrix V is orthogonal. I.e. A =
035 * V.times(D.times(V.transpose())) and V.times(V.transpose()) equals the
036 * identity matrix.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * If A is not symmetric, then the eigenvalue matrix D is block diagonal with
040 * the real eigenvalues in 1-by-1 blocks and any complex eigenvalues, lambda +
041 * i*mu, in 2-by-2 blocks, [lambda, mu; -mu, lambda]. The columns of V represent
042 * the eigenvectors in the sense that A*V = V*D, i.e. A.times(V) equals
043 * V.times(D). The matrix V may be badly conditioned, or even singular, so the
044 * validity of the equation A = V*D*inverse(V) depends upon V.cond().
045 * </p>
046 * 
047 * @version 2022/06/19
048 */
049public class EigenDecompositionJama implements RealEigenDecomposition {
050        
051        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
052        public static final double DefaultZeroTolerance = 1e-12;
053
054        private final int n;                    // row and column dimension (square matrix).
055        private final boolean issymmetric;      // symmetry flag.
056        private final double[] d;               // real parts of eigenvalues.
057        private final double[] e;               // imaginary parts of eigenvalues.
058        private final double[][] V;             // array for internal storage of eigenvectors.
059        
060        private double[][] H;                   // array for internal storage of nonsymmetric Hessenberg form.
061        private double[] ort;                   // working storage for nonsymmetric algorithm.
062        
063        private final double symmetryTol;
064        private final double zeroTol;
065
066        /**
067         * Constructor. 
068         * Checks for symmetry, then constructs the eigenvalue decomposition.
069         * 
070         * @param M matrix to be decomposed
071         * @param symmetryTol absolute threshold for determining matrix symmetry
072         * @param zeroTol absolute threshold for determining zero matrix entries
073         */
074        public EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix M, double symmetryTol, double zeroTol)
075                        throws MaxIterationsExceededException {
076                
077                final double[][] A = M.getData();
078                this.symmetryTol = symmetryTol;
079                this.zeroTol = zeroTol;
080                this.n = M.getColumnDimension();
081                this.V = new double[n][n];
082                this.d = new double[n];
083                this.e = new double[n];
084                
085                this.issymmetric = Matrix.isSymmetric(M, this.symmetryTol);
086
087//              issymmetric = true;
088//              for (int j = 0; (j < n) & issymmetric; j++) {
089//                      for (int i = 0; (i < n) & issymmetric; i++) {
090//                              issymmetric = (A[i][j] == A[j][i]);
091//                      }
092//              }
093
094                if (issymmetric) {
095                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
096                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
097                                        V[i][j] = A[i][j];
098                                }
099                        }
100                        tred2();        // Tridiagonalize.
101                        tql2();         // Diagonalize.
102
103                } else {
104                        this.H = new double[n][n];
105                        this.ort = new double[n];
106                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
107                                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
108                                        H[i][j] = A[i][j];
109                                }
110                        }
111                        orthes();       // Reduce to Hessenberg form.
112                        hqr2();         // Reduce Hessenberg to real Schur form.
113                }
114        }
115        
116        /**
117         * Constructor using default tolerance setting.
118         * See also {@link #DefaultSymmetryTolerance},  {@link #DefaultZeroTolerance}.
119         * 
120         * @param M matrix to be decomposed
121         */
122        public EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix M) {
123                this(M, DefaultSymmetryTolerance, DefaultZeroTolerance);
124        }
125        
126        // ------------------------ Public Methods ------------------------
127        
128        /**
129         * Returns true if the decomposed matrix is considered symmetric.
130         * See also {@link #EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix, double, double)},
131         * {@link #DefaultSymmetryTolerance}.
132         * 
133         * @return true if symmetric, false otherwise
134         */
135        public boolean isSymmetric() {
136                return this.issymmetric;
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
141         * vectors.
142         * 
143         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
144         */
145        @Override
146        public RealMatrix getV() {
147                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
148        }
149        
150        /**
151         * Return the transpose of the eigenvector matrix.
152         * The eigenvectors are the rows of the returned matrix.
153         * 
154         * @return the transposed matrix of eigenvectors
155         */
156        public RealMatrix getVT() {
157                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V).transpose();
158        }
159        
160         /**
161     * Returns a copy of the specified eigenvector, i.e., the
162     * associated column vector of the matrix returned
163     * by {@link #getV()}.
164     * 
165     * @param k index of the eigenvector (counting from 0).
166     * @return a copy of the k-th eigenvector
167     */
168        @Override
169    public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
170        double[] ev = new double[n];
171        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
172                ev[i] = V[i][k];
173        }
174        return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ev);
175    }
176
177        /**
178         * Return the real parts of the eigenvalues
179         * @return real(diag(D))
180         */
181        @Override
182        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
183                return d;
184        }
185
186        /**
187         * Return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
188         * @return imag(diag(D))
189         */
190        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
191                return e;
192        }
193        
194        @Override
195        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
196                return d[k];
197        }
198        
199        public double getImagEigenvalue(int k) {
200                return e[k];
201        }
202        
203        /**
204     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
205     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
206     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
207     * element is not equal to zero.
208     *
209     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
210     */
211        @Override
212    public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
213        for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
214            if (Math.abs(e[i]) > zeroTol) {
215                return true;
216            }
217        }
218        return false;
219    }
220        
221//      /**
222//       * Return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
223//       * @return D
224//       */
225//      public RealMatrix getD() {
226//              final double[][] D = new double[n][n];
227//              for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
228//                      for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
229//                              D[i][j] = 0.0;
230//                      }
231//                      D[i][i] = d[i];
232//                      if (e[i] > 0) {
233//                              D[i][i + 1] = e[i];
234//                      } else if (e[i] < 0) {
235//                              D[i][i - 1] = e[i];
236//                      }
237//              }
238//              return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(D);
239//      }
240    
241    /**
242     * Gets the block diagonal matrix D of the decomposition.
243     * D is a block diagonal matrix.
244     * Real eigenvalues are on the diagonal while complex values are on
245     * 2x2 blocks {{real pos imaginary}, {neg imaginary, real}}.
246     * WB: Wonder if indexes are safe!
247     *
248         * @return D
249         */
250        @Override
251        public RealMatrix getD() {
252                RealMatrix D = MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d);
253                for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
254                        if (e[i] > zeroTol) {
255                                D.setEntry(i, i + 1, e[i]);
256                        } else if (e[i] < -zeroTol) {
257                                D.setEntry(i, i - 1, e[i]);
258                        }
259                }
260                return D;
261        }
262        
263        /**
264     * Calculates and returns the determinant of the decomposed matrix.
265     *
266     * @return the determinant of the matrix.
267     */
268    public double getDeterminant() {
269        double determinant = 1.0;
270        for (double lambda : d) {
271            determinant = determinant * lambda;
272        }
273        return determinant;
274    }
275
276        // ------------------------ Private Methods ------------------------
277
278        // Symmetric Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
279        private void tred2() {
280                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tred2 by
281                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
282                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
283                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
284                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
285                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
286                }
287
288                // Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
289                for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) {
290                        // Scale to avoid under/overflow.
291                        double scale = 0.0;
292                        double h = 0.0;
293                        for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
294                                scale = scale + Math.abs(d[k]);
295                        }
296                        if (scale == 0.0) {
297                                e[i] = d[i - 1];
298                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
299                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
300                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
301                                        V[j][i] = 0.0;
302                                }
303                        } else {
304                                // Generate Householder vector.
305                                for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
306                                        d[k] /= scale;
307                                        h += d[k] * d[k];
308                                }
309                                double f = d[i - 1];
310                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
311                                if (f > 0) {
312                                        g = -g;
313                                }
314                                e[i] = scale * g;
315                                h = h - f * g;
316                                d[i - 1] = f - g;
317                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
318                                        e[j] = 0.0;
319                                }
320
321                                // Apply similarity transformation to remaining columns.
322                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
323                                        f = d[j];
324                                        V[j][i] = f;
325                                        g = e[j] + V[j][j] * f;
326                                        for (int k = j + 1; k <= i - 1; k++) {
327                                                g += V[k][j] * d[k];
328                                                e[k] += V[k][j] * f;
329                                        }
330                                        e[j] = g;
331                                }
332                                f = 0.0;
333                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
334                                        e[j] /= h;
335                                        f += e[j] * d[j];
336                                }
337                                final double hh = f / (h + h);
338                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
339                                        e[j] -= hh * d[j];
340                                }
341                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
342                                        f = d[j];
343                                        g = e[j];
344                                        for (int k = j; k <= i - 1; k++) {
345                                                V[k][j] -= (f * e[k] + g * d[k]);
346                                        }
347                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
348                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
349                                }
350                        }
351                        d[i] = h;
352                }
353
354                // Accumulate transformations.
355                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
356                        V[n - 1][i] = V[i][i];
357                        V[i][i] = 1.0;
358                        final double h = d[i + 1];
359                        if (h != 0.0) {
360                                for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
361                                        d[k] = V[k][i + 1] / h;
362                                }
363                                for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
364                                        double g = 0.0;
365                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
366                                                g += V[k][i + 1] * V[k][j];
367                                        }
368                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
369                                                V[k][j] -= g * d[k];
370                                        }
371                                }
372                        }
373                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
374                                V[k][i + 1] = 0.0;
375                        }
376                }
377                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
378                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
379                        V[n - 1][j] = 0.0;
380                }
381                V[n - 1][n - 1] = 1.0;
382                e[0] = 0.0;
383        }
384
385        // Symmetric tridiagonal QL algorithm.
386        private void tql2() {
387                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tql2, by
388                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
389                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
390                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
391                for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
392                        e[i - 1] = e[i];
393                }
394                e[n - 1] = 0.0;
395
396                double f = 0.0;
397                double tst1 = 0.0;
398                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
399                for (int l = 0; l < n; l++) {
400                        // Find small subdiagonal element
401                        tst1 = Math.max(tst1, Math.abs(d[l]) + Math.abs(e[l]));
402                        int m = l;
403                        while (m < n) {
404                                if (Math.abs(e[m]) <= eps * tst1) {
405                                        break;
406                                }
407                                m++;
408                        }
409
410                        // If m == l, d[l] is an eigenvalue,
411                        // otherwise, iterate.
412                        if (m > l) {
413                                int iter = 0;
414                                do {
415                                        iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
416                                        // Compute implicit shift
417                                        double g = d[l];
418                                        double p = (d[l + 1] - g) / (2.0 * e[l]);
419                                        double r = Math.hypot(p, 1.0);
420                                        if (p < 0) {
421                                                r = -r;
422                                        }
423                                        d[l] = e[l] / (p + r);
424                                        d[l + 1] = e[l] * (p + r);
425                                        final double dl1 = d[l + 1];
426                                        double h = g - d[l];
427                                        for (int i = l + 2; i < n; i++) {
428                                                d[i] -= h;
429                                        }
430                                        f = f + h;
431
432                                        // Implicit QL transformation.
433                                        p = d[m];
434                                        double c = 1.0;
435                                        double c2 = c;
436                                        double c3 = c;
437                                        final double el1 = e[l + 1];
438                                        double s = 0.0;
439                                        double s2 = 0.0;
440                                        for (int i = m - 1; i >= l; i--) {
441                                                c3 = c2;
442                                                c2 = c;
443                                                s2 = s;
444                                                g = c * e[i];
445                                                h = c * p;
446                                                r = Math.hypot(p, e[i]);
447                                                e[i + 1] = s * r;
448                                                s = e[i] / r;
449                                                c = p / r;
450                                                p = c * d[i] - s * g;
451                                                d[i + 1] = h + s * (c * g + s * d[i]);
452
453                                                // Accumulate transformation.
454                                                for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
455                                                        h = V[k][i + 1];
456                                                        V[k][i + 1] = s * V[k][i] + c * h;
457                                                        V[k][i] = c * V[k][i] - s * h;
458                                                }
459                                        }
460                                        p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e[l] / dl1;
461                                        e[l] = s * p;
462                                        d[l] = c * p;
463
464                                        // Check for convergence.
465                                } while (Math.abs(e[l]) > eps * tst1);
466                        }
467                        d[l] = d[l] + f;
468                        e[l] = 0.0;
469                }
470
471                // Sort eigenvalues and corresponding vectors.
472                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
473                        int k = i;
474                        double p = d[i];
475                        for (int j = i + 1; j < n; j++) {
476                                if (d[j] < p) {
477                                        k = j;
478                                        p = d[j];
479                                }
480                        }
481                        if (k != i) {
482                                d[k] = d[i];
483                                d[i] = p;
484                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
485                                        p = V[j][i];
486                                        V[j][i] = V[j][k];
487                                        V[j][k] = p;
488                                }
489                        }
490                }
491        }
492
493        // Nonsymmetric reduction to Hessenberg form.
494        private void orthes() {
495                // This is derived from the Algol procedures orthes and ortran,
496                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
497                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
498                // Fortran subroutines in EISPACK.
499                final int low = 0;
500                final int high = n - 1;
501                
502                for (int m = low + 1; m <= high - 1; m++) {
503
504                        // Scale column.
505
506                        double scale = 0.0;
507                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
508                                scale = scale + Math.abs(H[i][m - 1]);
509                        }
510                        if (scale != 0.0) {
511                                // Compute Householder transformation.
512                                double h = 0.0;
513                                for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
514                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1] / scale;
515                                        h += ort[i] * ort[i];
516                                }
517                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
518                                if (ort[m] > 0) {
519                                        g = -g;
520                                }
521                                h = h - ort[m] * g;
522                                ort[m] = ort[m] - g;
523
524                                // Apply Householder similarity transformation
525                                // H = (I-u*u'/h)*H*(I-u*u')/h)
526                                for (int j = m; j < n; j++) {
527                                        double f = 0.0;
528                                        for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
529                                                f += ort[i] * H[i][j];
530                                        }
531                                        f = f / h;
532                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
533                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[i];
534                                        }
535                                }
536
537                                for (int i = 0; i <= high; i++) {
538                                        double f = 0.0;
539                                        for (int j = high; j >= m; j--) {
540                                                f += ort[j] * H[i][j];
541                                        }
542                                        f = f / h;
543                                        for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
544                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[j];
545                                        }
546                                }
547                                ort[m] = scale * ort[m];
548                                H[m][m - 1] = scale * g;
549                        }
550                }
551
552                // Accumulate transformations (Algol's ortran).
553                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
554                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
555                                V[i][j] = (i == j ? 1.0 : 0.0);
556                        }
557                }
558
559                for (int m = high - 1; m >= low + 1; m--) {
560                        if (H[m][m - 1] != 0.0) {
561                                for (int i = m + 1; i <= high; i++) {
562                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1];
563                                }
564                                for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
565                                        double g = 0.0;
566                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
567                                                g += ort[i] * V[i][j];
568                                        }
569                                        // Double division avoids possible underflow
570                                        g = (g / ort[m]) / H[m][m - 1];
571                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
572                                                V[i][j] += g * ort[i];
573                                        }
574                                }
575                        }
576                }
577        }
578
579//      // Complex scalar division (old)
580//      private transient double cdivr, cdivi;
581//
582//      @Deprecated
583//      private void cdivOld(final double xr, final double xi, final double yr, final double yi) {
584//              double r, d;
585//              if (Math.abs(yr) > Math.abs(yi)) {
586//                      r = yi / yr;
587//                      d = yr + r * yi;
588//                      cdivr = (xr + r * xi) / d;
589//                      cdivi = (xi - r * xr) / d;
590//              } else {
591//                      r = yr / yi;
592//                      d = yi + r * yr;
593//                      cdivr = (r * xr + xi) / d;
594//                      cdivi = (r * xi - xr) / d;
595//              }
596//      }
597        
598    /**
599     * Performs a division of two complex numbers.
600     *
601     * @param xr real part of the first number
602     * @param xi imaginary part of the first number
603     * @param yr real part of the second number
604     * @param yi imaginary part of the second number
605     * @return result of the complex division
606     */
607    private Complex cdiv(final double xr, final double xi,
608                         final double yr, final double yi) {
609        return new Complex(xr, xi).divide(new Complex(yr, yi));
610    }
611
612        // Nonsymmetric reduction from Hessenberg to real Schur form.
613        private void hqr2() {
614                // This is derived from the Algol procedure hqr2,
615                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
616                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
617                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
618                
619                // Initialize
620                final int nn = this.n;
621                int n = nn - 1;
622                final int low = 0;
623                final int high = nn - 1;
624                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
625                double exshift = 0.0;
626                double p = 0, q = 0, r = 0, s = 0, z = 0, t, w, x, y;
627
628                // Store roots isolated by balanc and compute matrix norm
629                double norm = 0.0;
630                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
631                        if (i < low | i > high) {
632                                d[i] = H[i][i];
633                                e[i] = 0.0;
634                        }
635                        for (int j = Math.max(i - 1, 0); j < nn; j++) {
636                                norm = norm + Math.abs(H[i][j]);
637                        }
638                }
639
640                // Outer loop over eigenvalue index
641                int iter = 0;
642                while (n >= low) {
643                        // Look for single small sub-diagonal element
644                        int l = n;
645                        while (l > low) {
646                                s = Math.abs(H[l - 1][l - 1]) + Math.abs(H[l][l]);
647                                if (s == 0.0) {
648                                        s = norm;
649                                }
650                                if (Math.abs(H[l][l - 1]) < eps * s) {
651                                        break;
652                                }
653                                l--;
654                        }
655
656                        // Check for convergence
657                        // One root found
658                        if (l == n) {
659                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
660                                d[n] = H[n][n];
661                                e[n] = 0.0;
662                                n--;
663                                iter = 0;
664                                // Two roots found
665                        } else if (l == n - 1) {
666                                w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
667                                p = (H[n - 1][n - 1] - H[n][n]) / 2.0;
668                                q = p * p + w;
669                                z = Math.sqrt(Math.abs(q));
670                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
671                                H[n - 1][n - 1] = H[n - 1][n - 1] + exshift;
672                                x = H[n][n];
673
674                                // Real pair
675                                if (q >= 0) {
676                                        if (p >= 0) {
677                                                z = p + z;
678                                        } else {
679                                                z = p - z;
680                                        }
681                                        d[n - 1] = x + z;
682                                        d[n] = d[n - 1];
683                                        if (z != 0.0) {
684                                                d[n] = x - w / z;
685                                        }
686                                        e[n - 1] = 0.0;
687                                        e[n] = 0.0;
688                                        x = H[n][n - 1];
689                                        s = Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(z);
690                                        p = x / s;
691                                        q = z / s;
692                                        r = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q);
693                                        p = p / r;
694                                        q = q / r;
695
696                                        // Row modification
697                                        for (int j = n - 1; j < nn; j++) {
698                                                z = H[n - 1][j];
699                                                H[n - 1][j] = q * z + p * H[n][j];
700                                                H[n][j] = q * H[n][j] - p * z;
701                                        }
702
703                                        // Column modification
704                                        for (int i = 0; i <= n; i++) {
705                                                z = H[i][n - 1];
706                                                H[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * H[i][n];
707                                                H[i][n] = q * H[i][n] - p * z;
708                                        }
709
710                                        // Accumulate transformations
711                                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
712                                                z = V[i][n - 1];
713                                                V[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * V[i][n];
714                                                V[i][n] = q * V[i][n] - p * z;
715                                        }
716
717                                        // Complex pair
718                                } else {
719                                        d[n - 1] = x + p;
720                                        d[n] = x + p;
721                                        e[n - 1] = z;
722                                        e[n] = -z;
723                                }
724                                n = n - 2;
725                                iter = 0;
726                                // No convergence yet
727                        } else {
728                                // Form shift
729                                x = H[n][n];
730                                y = 0.0;
731                                w = 0.0;
732                                if (l < n) {
733                                        y = H[n - 1][n - 1];
734                                        w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
735                                }
736
737                                // Wilkinson's original ad hoc shift
738                                if (iter == 10) {
739                                        exshift += x;
740                                        for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
741                                                H[i][i] -= x;
742                                        }
743                                        s = Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) + Math.abs(H[n - 1][n - 2]);
744                                        x = y = 0.75 * s;
745                                        w = -0.4375 * s * s;
746                                }
747
748                                // MATLAB's new ad hoc shift
749                                if (iter == 30) {
750                                        s = (y - x) / 2.0;
751                                        s = s * s + w;
752                                        if (s > 0) {
753                                                s = Math.sqrt(s);
754                                                if (y < x) {
755                                                        s = -s;
756                                                }
757                                                s = x - w / ((y - x) / 2.0 + s);
758                                                for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
759                                                        H[i][i] -= s;
760                                                }
761                                                exshift += s;
762                                                x = y = w = 0.964;
763                                        }
764                                }
765
766                                iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
767                                if (iter > 30) {
768                                        throw new MaxIterationsExceededException(30);   // wilbur added as safeguard
769                                }
770
771                                // Look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements
772                                int m = n - 2;
773                                while (m >= l) {
774                                        z = H[m][m];
775                                        r = x - z;
776                                        s = y - z;
777                                        p = (r * s - w) / H[m + 1][m] + H[m][m + 1];
778                                        q = H[m + 1][m + 1] - z - r - s;
779                                        r = H[m + 2][m + 1];
780                                        s = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
781                                        p = p / s;
782                                        q = q / s;
783                                        r = r / s;
784                                        if (m == l) {
785                                                break;
786                                        }
787                                        if (Math.abs(H[m][m - 1]) * (Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r)) < eps
788                                                        * (Math.abs(p) * (Math.abs(H[m - 1][m - 1]) + Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(H[m + 1][m + 1])))) {
789                                                break;
790                                        }
791                                        m--;
792                                }
793
794                                for (int i = m + 2; i <= n; i++) {
795                                        H[i][i - 2] = 0.0;
796                                        if (i > m + 2) {
797                                                H[i][i - 3] = 0.0;
798                                        }
799                                }
800
801                                // Double QR step involving rows l:n and columns m:n
802                                for (int k = m; k <= n - 1; k++) {
803                                        final boolean notlast = (k != n - 1);
804                                        if (k != m) {
805                                                p = H[k][k - 1];
806                                                q = H[k + 1][k - 1];
807                                                r = (notlast ? H[k + 2][k - 1] : 0.0);
808                                                x = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
809                                                if (x != 0.0) {
810                                                        p = p / x;
811                                                        q = q / x;
812                                                        r = r / x;
813                                                }
814                                        }
815                                        if (x == 0.0) {
816                                                break;
817                                        }
818                                        s = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q + r * r);
819                                        if (p < 0) {
820                                                s = -s;
821                                        }
822                                        if (s != 0) {
823                                                if (k != m) {
824                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -s * x;
825                                                } else if (l != m) {
826                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -H[k][k - 1];
827                                                }
828                                                p = p + s;
829                                                x = p / s;
830                                                y = q / s;
831                                                z = r / s;
832                                                q = q / p;
833                                                r = r / p;
834
835                                                // Row modification
836
837                                                for (int j = k; j < nn; j++) {
838                                                        p = H[k][j] + q * H[k + 1][j];
839                                                        if (notlast) {
840                                                                p = p + r * H[k + 2][j];
841                                                                H[k + 2][j] = H[k + 2][j] - p * z;
842                                                        }
843                                                        H[k][j] = H[k][j] - p * x;
844                                                        H[k + 1][j] = H[k + 1][j] - p * y;
845                                                }
846
847                                                // Column modification
848
849                                                for (int i = 0; i <= Math.min(n, k + 3); i++) {
850                                                        p = x * H[i][k] + y * H[i][k + 1];
851                                                        if (notlast) {
852                                                                p = p + z * H[i][k + 2];
853                                                                H[i][k + 2] = H[i][k + 2] - p * r;
854                                                        }
855                                                        H[i][k] = H[i][k] - p;
856                                                        H[i][k + 1] = H[i][k + 1] - p * q;
857                                                }
858
859                                                // Accumulate transformations
860
861                                                for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
862                                                        p = x * V[i][k] + y * V[i][k + 1];
863                                                        if (notlast) {
864                                                                p = p + z * V[i][k + 2];
865                                                                V[i][k + 2] = V[i][k + 2] - p * r;
866                                                        }
867                                                        V[i][k] = V[i][k] - p;
868                                                        V[i][k + 1] = V[i][k + 1] - p * q;
869                                                }
870                                        } // (s != 0)
871                                } // k loop
872                        } // check convergence
873                } // while (n >= low)
874
875                // Backsubstitute to find vectors of upper triangular form
876
877                if (norm == 0.0) {
878                        return;
879                }
880
881                for (n = nn - 1; n >= 0; n--) {
882                        p = d[n];
883                        q = e[n];
884
885                        // Real vector
886                        if (q == 0) {
887                                int l = n;
888                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
889                                for (int i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
890                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
891                                        r = 0.0;
892                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
893                                                r = r + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
894                                        }
895                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
896                                                z = w;
897                                                s = r;
898                                        } else {
899                                                l = i;
900                                                if (e[i] == 0.0) {
901                                                        if (w != 0.0) {
902                                                                H[i][n] = -r / w;
903                                                        } else {
904                                                                H[i][n] = -r / (eps * norm);
905                                                        }
906
907                                                        // Solve real equations
908
909                                                } else {
910                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
911                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
912                                                        q = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i];
913                                                        t = (x * s - z * r) / q;
914                                                        H[i][n] = t;
915                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > Math.abs(z)) {
916                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-r - w * t) / x;
917                                                        } else {
918                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-s - y * t) / z;
919                                                        }
920                                                }
921
922                                                // Overflow control
923
924                                                t = Math.abs(H[i][n]);
925                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
926                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
927                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
928                                                        }
929                                                }
930                                        }
931                                }
932                                // Complex vector
933                        } else if (q < 0) {
934                                int l = n - 1;
935                                // Last vector component imaginary so matrix is triangular
936                                if (Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) > Math.abs(H[n - 1][n])) {
937                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = q / H[n][n - 1];
938                                        H[n - 1][n] = -(H[n][n] - p) / H[n][n - 1];
939                                } else {
940//                                      cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
941                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
942                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();        //cdivr;
943                                        H[n - 1][n] = cpx.getImaginary();               //cdivi;
944                                }
945                                H[n][n - 1] = 0.0;
946                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
947                                for (int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--) {
948                                        double ra, sa, vr, vi;
949                                        ra = 0.0;
950                                        sa = 0.0;
951                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
952                                                ra = ra + H[i][j] * H[j][n - 1];
953                                                sa = sa + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
954                                        }
955                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
956
957                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
958                                                z = w;
959                                                r = ra;
960                                                s = sa;
961                                        } else {
962                                                l = i;
963                                                if (e[i] == 0) {
964                                                        // cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
965                                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
966                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();    //cdivr;
967                                                        H[i][n] = cpx.getImaginary();   //cdivi;
968                                                } else {
969
970                                                        // Solve complex equations
971
972                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
973                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
974                                                        vr = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i] - q * q;
975                                                        vi = (d[i] - p) * 2.0 * q;
976                                                        if (vr == 0.0 & vi == 0.0) {
977                                                                vr = eps * norm * (Math.abs(w) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(y) + Math.abs(z));
978                                                        }
979//                                                      cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
980                                                        Complex cpx1 = cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
981                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx1.getReal();   //cdivr;
982                                                        H[i][n] = cpx1.getImaginary();  //cdivi;
983                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > (Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(q))) {
984                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = (-ra - w * H[i][n - 1] + q * H[i][n]) / x;
985                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-sa - w * H[i][n] - q * H[i][n - 1]) / x;
986                                                        } else {
987//                                                              cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
988                                                                Complex cpx2 = cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
989                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = cpx2.getReal();       //cdivr;
990                                                                H[i + 1][n] = cpx2.getImaginary();      //cdivi;
991                                                        }
992                                                }
993
994                                                // Overflow control
995
996                                                t = Math.max(Math.abs(H[i][n - 1]), Math.abs(H[i][n]));
997                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
998                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
999                                                                H[j][n - 1] = H[j][n - 1] / t;
1000                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
1001                                                        }
1002                                                }
1003                                        }
1004                                }
1005                        }
1006                }
1007
1008                // Vectors of isolated roots
1009                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
1010                        if (i < low | i > high) {
1011                                for (int j = i; j < nn; j++) {
1012                                        V[i][j] = H[i][j];
1013                                }
1014                        }
1015                }
1016
1017                // Back transformation to get eigenvectors of original matrix
1018                for (int j = nn - 1; j >= low; j--) {
1019                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
1020                                z = 0.0;
1021                                for (int k = low; k <= Math.min(j, high); k++) {
1022                                        z = z + V[i][k] * H[k][j];
1023                                }
1024                                V[i][j] = z;
1025                        }
1026                }
1027        }
1028        
1029        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1030        
1031        public static void main(String[] args) {
1032                
1033                // 2 examples where Apache's implementation fails:
1034                
1035                // non-symmetric example:
1036//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]  
1037//                      {{4455707.000000000, 16685.500000000, 17344.500000000, 142.000000000}, 
1038//                      {-951005821.436619800, -3525507.007042253, -4059917.288732395, -33371.000000000}, 
1039//                      {-997789920.901407700, -4059917.288732392, -3879630.838028166, -34689.000000000}, 
1040//                      {70029373562.509700000, 297685588.322852130, 314485277.997519970, 2949430.845070420}});
1041                
1042                // symmetric example:
1043                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1044                        {{-635322.712034708800000, 4756.174679968795000, -265184.797553499500000, 20382.684252847448000}, 
1045                        {4756.174679968796000, 560670.646574945200000, 0.190328961575323, -0.016193729208773}, 
1046                        {-265184.797553499500000, 0.190328961575416, 74652.065423977560000, 1.470729864949432}, 
1047                        {20382.684252847444000, -0.016193729208773, 1.470729864949432, 0.000035786438260}});
1048                
1049                // singular matrix
1050//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1051//                              {{2, 1, 0},
1052//                              {0, 2, 0},
1053//                              {0, 0, 0}});
1054                
1055                // singular matrix
1056//                              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1057//                                              {{2, 1, 4, -1},
1058//                                              {3, -2, 1, 0},
1059//                                              {5, 1, -3, 2},
1060//                                              {-1, 3, 3, -1}});
1061                
1062                PrintPrecision.set(9);
1063                
1064                System.out.println("det(M) = " + Matrix.determinant(M));
1065                System.out.println("symmetric(M) = " + MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(M, 1e-12));
1066                System.out.println("singular(M) = " + Matrix.isSingular(M));
1067                
1068                {
1069                        System.out.println("\nJAMA: *****************************");
1070                        EigenDecompositionJama ed = new EigenDecompositionJama(M);
1071                        System.out.println("evalsRe = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
1072                        System.out.println("evalsIm = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getImagEigenvalues()));
1073                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1074                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1075                        System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getV()));
1076                }
1077                
1078                {
1079                        System.out.println("\nApache Commons Math: *****************************");
1080                        org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition  ed = 
1081                                        new org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition(M);
1082                        System.out.println("evalsRe = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
1083                        System.out.println("evalsIm = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getImagEigenvalues()));
1084                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1085                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1086                        System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getV()));
1087                }
1088        }
1089        
1090        
1091}
